# Pull Request

## Description

Brief description of what this PR does.

Fixes # (issue number)

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test coverage improvement
- [ ] Build/CI configuration

## Changes Made

Detailed list of changes:

- Changed X to Y
- Added new feature Z
- Fixed bug in component A

## Testing

Describe how you tested your changes:

- [ ] Ran existing test suite (`bun test`)
- [ ] Added new tests for this feature/fix
- [ ] Manually tested the following scenarios:
  - Scenario 1: [Description]
  - Scenario 2: [Description]
- [ ] Tested on multiple environments (if applicable)

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the project's code style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md file

## Documentation

- [ ] README.md updated (if needed)
- [ ] API documentation updated (if needed)
- [ ] ARCHITECTURE.md updated (if needed)
- [ ] Inline code comments added (for complex logic)

## Screenshots (if applicable)

Add screenshots or videos demonstrating the changes, especially for UI/UX changes.

## Performance Impact

Describe any performance implications:

- [ ] No performance impact
- [ ] Performance improvement: [describe]
- [ ] Performance regression: [describe and justify]
- [ ] Not applicable

## Breaking Changes

If this is a breaking change, describe:

1. What breaks?
2. How should users migrate?
3. Is there a deprecation path?

## Security Considerations

- [ ] This PR does not introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Security implications have been reviewed
- [ ] Security-sensitive code has been audited
- [ ] Not applicable

## Additional Notes

Any additional information reviewers should know:

- Dependencies added/updated
- Configuration changes required
- Deployment considerations
- Related PRs or issues

## Reviewer Guidance

Specific areas where you'd like reviewer focus:

- [ ] Algorithm correctness
- [ ] Error handling
- [ ] Performance
- [ ] Security
- [ ] API design
- [ ] Test coverage

---

**For Maintainers**:

- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Tests passing in CI
- [ ] Documentation adequate
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md updated
- [ ] Ready to merge
